snippet: Though labor welcomed President Obama’s action, observers said wage stagnation is the bigger problem.
abstract: News Analysis; Pres Obama's proposed rule for expanding number of American workers eligible for overtime pay will not significantly help increase middle-class wages; analysts say wage stagnation affects 90 percent of workers; pro-business critics maintain rule will raise costs for employers and lead to less hiring.
lead_paragraph: Though labor welcomed President Obama’s action, observers said wage stagnation is the bigger problem.

headline.print_headline: Obama Overtime Rule Scratches the Surface in Helping the Middle Class
headline.main: Obama Overtime Rule Scratches the Surface in Helping the Middle Class
